meanings.definition: To make something larger or more extensive than usual.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys supersizing her meals at the fast food restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to supersize their product line to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of supersizing a tiny house into a mansion is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to supersize the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered, threatening to supersize into a powerful tornado.

meanings.definition: The act of increasing the size or quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: Supersizing of the portions at the restaurant led to a lot of food waste.
meanings.sent2: The supersizing of the company's profits was a result of their new marketing strategy.
meanings.sent3: The supersizing of the balloon made it impossible to fit through the door.
meanings.sent4: The supersizing of the project budget caused some concerns among the team.
meanings.sent5: The supersizing of the garden made it a beautiful oasis in the neighborhood.
